articles.content: This artist’s concept shows the nova system HM Sagittae (HM Sge), where a white dwarf star is pulling material from its red giant companion. This forms a blazing hot disk around the dwarf, which can … [+7793 chars]

articles.title: Quantum Magic: How “Super Photons” Are Shaping the Future of Physics - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Researchers at the University of Bonn have demonstrated that super photons, or photon Bose-Einstein condensates, conform to fundamental physics theorems, enabling insights into properties that are often difficult to observe. Under suitable conditions, thousan…
articles.content: Artist’s view of a photonic Bose-Einstein condensate (yellow) in a bath of dye molecules (red) that has been perturbated by an external light source (white flash). Credit: A. Erglis/Albert-Ludwigs Un… [+5566 chars]

articles.author: Paige Cornwell
articles.title: Apollo 8 astronaut Bill Anders died of blunt-force injuries, coroner says - The Seattle Times
articles.description: Retired Maj. Gen. William Anders, an Apollo 8 astronaut, died of multiple blunt-force injuries when the plane he was piloting last week crashed.
articles.content: Retired Maj. Gen. William Anders, the Apollo 8 astronaut, died of multiple blunt-force injuries when the plane he was piloting last week crashed off the coast of Jones Island, officials said Wednesda… [+1514 chars]

articles.title: Evidence for transient morning water frost deposits on the Tharsis volcanoes of Mars - Nature.com
articles.description: High-resolution spacecraft imagery has revealed transient deposits that appear in the early mornings of cold seasons at the high altitudes of the Tharsis volcanoes on Mars, consistent with water frost of atmospheric origin.
